titles.title: Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition Act
Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition Act
To provide for the recognition of certain Native communities under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 21 - 5.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 412.

bill.summary: 11/4/1997--Introduced. Unrecognized Southeast Alaska Native Communities Recognition Act - Amends the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act to permit the Native villages of: (1) Haines, Ketchikan, Petersburg, and Wrangell, Alaska to organize as an Urban Corporation; and (2) Tenakee, Alaska to organize as a Group Corporation. Mandates a specified report. Authorizes appropriations of such sums as are necessary to provide the Native Corporations with planning grants.
